thread.title: 2 workshops for aspiring writers in Seattle, Port Townsend
thread.title_full: 2 workshops for aspiring writers in Seattle, Port Townsend | The Seattle Times

author: Mary Ann Gwinn
title: 2 workshops for aspiring writers in Seattle, Port Townsend
text:
Summer’s here, and it’s time for two prominent regional writers conferences, designed for aspiring authors of all levels.
In the Seattle area, the Pacific Northwest Writers Association is holding its 60th annual conference July 16-19 at the Hilton Seattle Airport & Conference Center. This conference features a roster of workshops, author appearances and sessions on the business of writing. For a full listing of the sessions offered, the program and conference pricing, go to www.pnwa.org/?page=conference .
This year’s keynote speaker is Andre Dubus III, author of “The House of Sand and Fog,” “The Garden of Days” and “Townie.” Other featured authors will include Nancy Kress, winner of the 2015 Nebula Award for best novella, mystery and thriller writers Robert Dugoni and Kevin O’Brien, and romance authors Gerri Russell and Elizabeth Boyle.
This year the conference will also hold a Young Author’s Day from noon-4 p.m. July 16 at the Hilton. The free event is targeted to kids, 8-12 years of age, with sessions taught by local authors and illustrators. Children must be accompanied by a parent or guardian. For information on young authors’ day, go to www.pnwa.org/events/event_details.asp?id=442152
 The conference offers opportunities for writers to connect with other writers, agents and editors. Writers looking for a more formal introduction to editors and agents can sign up for one of the conference’s “pitch blocks.” For more information on that process, go to pnwa.org/?page=powerpitch , or call 425-673-2665.
The Port Townsend Writers Conference takes place July 9-19 at Fort Worden. This conference offers a range of workshops, author readings and other programs. This year’s marquee-faculty member is Luis Alberto Urrea, author of 16 books, including “The Devil’s Highway,” “The Hummingbird’s Daughter” and “Into the Beautiful North.” For more information, go to centrum.org .
